data.title: Tanya Gurevich, MD
data.meta_description: Tanya Gurevich, MD, is the director of Parkinson's Disease and Neuroautonomic Service at the Movement Disorders Unit, TelAvivSouraskyMedicalCenter. She orchestrates an active clinic for patients with Parkinson's disease and other movement disorders, which provides patient care using a multidisciplinary approach. Multiple clinical trials are conducted under this flagship. She represents over 25 years of clinical and scientific expertise in neurology, particularly 15 years specializing in her special field of interest: movement disorders and autonomic disturbances. Dr. Gurevich is a full faculty member at the Sackler School of Medicine, TelAvivUniversity. She is a reviewer of various scientific journals, and a member of the Tel Aviv Sourasky Medical Center Ethics Committee.
data.meta_site_name: The Michael J. Fox Foundation for Parkinson's Research | Parkinson's Disease
data.text: Tanya Gurevich, MD, is the director of Parkinson's Disease and Neuroautonomic Service at the Movement Disorders Unit, TelAvivSouraskyMedicalCenter. She orchestrates an active clinic for patients with Parkinson's disease and other movement disorders, which provides patient care using a multidisciplinary approach. Multiple clinical trials are conducted under this flagship. She represents over 25 years of clinical and scientific expertise in neurology, particularly 15 years specializing in her special field of interest: movement disorders and autonomic disturbances. Dr. Gurevich is a full faculty member at the Sackler School of Medicine, TelAvivUniversity. She is a reviewer of various scientific journals, and a member of the Tel Aviv Sourasky Medical Center Ethics Committee.
